turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: My SmartHome Hub keeps disconnecting from the internet. I've tried restarting it multiple times, but it only stays connected for a few minutes before dropping again. This is incredibly frustrating!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I'm happy to help. To start, could you please tell me the model number of your SmartHome Hub? Also, what troubleshooting steps have you already tried, besides restarting the device?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's a SHH-2000. I've unplugged it, waited a minute, and plugged it back in. I've also tried pressing the reset button on the back, but it doesn't seem to do anything. Is there some secret combination of buttons I need to press? Why isn't this thing working?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thanks for that information. Have you tried checking your internet router to ensure that it is functioning correctly and that other devices can connect? Sometimes the issue isn't with the hub itself, but with the internet connection to the entire home. As for the reset button, hold it down for a full 10 seconds and see if it resets.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, the internet is fine; my laptop and phone are connected and working perfectly. Everything else is working, just not the hub. If the reset button isn't working and I've already tried the basic troubleshooting, what are my options? Am I just stuck with a useless brick now? Is there any way to remotely diagnose the problem?
